block.p: Robin Lee Alperstein and Seth David Gross were married last evening by Cantor Oreen Zeitlin at the Manhattan Penthouse in New York.

The couple attended the University of Chicago, where the bride received a master's degree in public policy and the bridegroom a bachelor's degree. They graduated from the New York University Law School, but did not become acquainted until they joined the New York law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore, where the bride is an associate.
Robin Lee Alperstein and Seth David Gross were married last evening by Cantor Oreen Zeitlin at the Manhattan Penthouse in New York.

The couple attended the University of Chicago, where the bride received a master's degree in public policy and the bridegroom a bachelor's degree. They graduated from the New York University Law School, but did not become acquainted until they joined the New York law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore, where the bride is an associate.
Ms. Alperstein, 34, will keep her name. She graduated from the University of Virginia. She is a daughter of Rosalind and Robert Alperstein of Wayne, N.J.
Mr. Gross, 30, is now a staff lawyer in criminal defense at the Legal Aid Society of New York. He is the son of Susan Gross of Gaithersburg, Md., and the late Stuart Gross of New York.
